Title.evidence: Purpose: To report a novel common-iliac-artery skirt technology (CST) in treating challenge iliac artery aneurysms.

Participants.evidence: Patients who received endovascular aneurysm repair (EVAR) in our center from 2014 to 2020 were retrospectively screened

Intervention.evidence: patients treated with CST or with IIA embolization (IIAE) were enrolled

Objective.evidence: Purpose: To report a novel common-iliac-artery skirt technology (CST) in treating challenge iliac artery aneurysms.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 39 CST patients, 26 IIAE patients, and 7 CST + IIAE patients were enrolled

Result_Outcome.evidence: CST group had significant shorter surgery time (CST 97.42 ± 3.891 vs. IIAE 141.0 ± 8.010, p < 0.001), shorter hospital stay (CST 15.35 ± 0.873 vs. IIAE 19.32 ± 1.067, p = 0.009)

Harms.evidence: lower in-hospital [CST 0% (0/39) vs. IIAE 11.5% (3/26), p = 0.059] and 1-year follow-up stent related MAEs [CST 6.7% (2/30) vs. IIAE 28.6% (6/21), p = 0.052]
